reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 105/02: EXTENDING TERM OF VALIDITY OF DRIVING INSTRUCTOR'S LICENCES
reg_info.reg_name_text: EXTENDING TERM OF VALIDITY OF DRIVING INSTRUCTOR’S LICENCES
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 105/02: EXTENDING TERM OF VALIDITY OF DRIVING INSTRUCTOR'S LICENCES
reg_info.act_under: Highway Traffic Act   Code de la route

content.content: 1. (1) Despite subsection 8 (1) of Regulation 586 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, the term of validity of a driving instructor’s licence is extended until the day this Regulation is revoked if, without the extension, the term of validity would expire under that subsection on or after the day this Regulation comes into force. O. Reg. 105/02, s. 1 (1). (2) A driving instructor’s licence whose term of validity is extended under subsection (1) is not renewable unless the licence is renewed within one year of the expiry date referred to in subsection 8 (1) of Regulation 586 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 105/02, s. 1 (2).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) Despite subsection 8 (1) of Regulation 586 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, the term of validity of a driving instructor’s licence is extended until the day this Regulation is revoked if, without the extension, the term of validity would expire under that subsection on or after the day this Regulation comes into force. O. Reg. 105/02, s. 1 (1).

(2) A driving instructor’s licence whose term of validity is extended under subsection (1) is not renewable unless the licence is renewed within one year of the expiry date referred to in subsection 8 (1) of Regulation 586 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 105/02, s. 1 (2).
